metadata.description:
This data set contains data of meteorological elements observation system of farmland station downstream of heihe hydrometeorological observation network from January 1, 2015 to October 29, 2015.The station is located at sidao bridge, dalai hubu town, ejin banner, Inner Mongolia.The latitude and longitude of the observation point are 101.1338e, 42.0048n, and 875m above sea level.The four-component radiometer is installed at 6m, facing due south;The two infrared thermometer sensors are installed at the position of 6m, facing south, and the probe is facing vertically downward.The two photosynthetic radiometers are installed at the position of 6m, facing due south, and the probes are vertically up and down in one direction.The soil temperature probe is buried at 0cm on the surface, 2cm and 4cm underground, and 2m to the south of the meteorological tower.The soil moisture sensors are respectively buried 2cm and 4cm underground, in the south due to 2m from the meteorological tower.The soil hot flow plates (3) are successively buried in the ground 6cm away from the weather tower 2m due south.
Radiation observation projects are: four components (DR, UR, DLR_Cor, ULR_Cor, Rn) (unit: watts per square meter), the surface radiation temperature (IRT_1, IRT_2) (unit: c), soil heat flux (Gs_1, Gs_2, Gs_3) (unit: watts per square meter), soil temperature (Ts_0cm Ts_2cm Ts_4cm) (unit: c), soil moisture (Ms_2cm, Ms_4cm) (unit:Volume water content, percentage), up and down photosynthetic effective radiation (PAR_up, PAR_down) (unit: micromole/m s).
Processing and quality control of observation data :(1) ensure 144 data per day (every 10min). If data is missing, it will be marked by -6999;Due to data storage problems, data was missing from September 25 to October 01, 2015;Soil heat flux of 3 and 0cm soil temperature was missing between 6.14-6.22 due to sensor problems.Due to sensor problems, the soil temperature of 0cm occasionally appeared problems between 6.09 and 9.22.Soil heat flux 2 was missing between 10.17 and 10.29 due to sensor problems.(2) eliminate the moments with duplicate records;(3) data that is obviously beyond the physical meaning or the range of the instrument is deleted;(4) the part marked by red letter in the data is the data in question;(5) the format of date and time is uniform, and the date and time are in the same column.For example, the time is: 2015-9-10-10:30;(6) the naming rule is: AWS+ site name.
Please refer to Li et al. (2013) for hydrometeorological network or site information, and Liu et al. (2011) for observation data processing.
metadata.descriptionCn:
该数据集包含了2015年1月1日至2015年10月29日黑河水文气象观测网下游农田站气象要素观测系统数据。站点位于内蒙古额济纳旗达来呼布镇四道桥，下垫面是甜瓜农田。观测点的经纬度是101.1338E, 42.0048N，海拔875m。四分量辐射仪安装在6m处，朝向正南；两个红外温度计传感器安装在6m处，朝向正南，探头朝向是垂直向下；两个光合有效辐射仪安装在6m处，朝向正南，探头垂直向上和向下方向各一个；土壤温度探头埋设在地表0cm和地下2cm、4cm处，并距离气象塔2m的正南方；土壤水分传感器分别埋设在地下2cm、4cm处，在距离气象塔2m的正南方；土壤热流板（3块）依次埋设在地下6cm处，并距离气象塔2m的正南方。
观测项目有：四分量辐射（DR、UR、DLR_Cor、ULR_Cor、Rn）(单位：瓦/平方米)、地表辐射温度（IRT_1、IRT_2）(单位：摄氏度)、土壤热通量（Gs_1、Gs_2、Gs_3）(单位：瓦/平方米)、土壤温度（Ts_0cm、Ts_2cm、Ts_4cm）(单位：摄氏度)、土壤水分（Ms_2cm、Ms_4cm）(单位：体积含水量，百分比)、向上和向下光合有效辐射（PAR_up、PAR_down）(单位：微摩尔/平方米秒)。
观测数据的处理与质量控制：（1）确保每天144个数据（每10min），若出现数据的缺失，则由-6999标示；由于数据存储问题，2015.9.25-10.01间数据缺失；土壤热通量3和0cm土壤温度由于传感器问题，在6.14-6.22间数据缺失；0cm土壤温度由于传感器问题，在6.09-9.22间偶尔出现问题；土壤热通量2由于传感器问题，在10.17-10.29间数据缺失；（2）剔除有重复记录的时刻；（3）删除了明显超出物理意义或超出仪器量程的数据；（4）数据中以红字标示的部分为有疑问的数据；（5）日期和时间的格式统一，并且日期、时间在同一列。如，时间为：2015-9-10 10:30；（6）命名规则为：AWS+站点名称。
水文气象网或站点信息请参考Li et al. (2013)，观测数据处理请参考Liu et al. (2011)。

background: The two-source energy balance (TSEB) model was successfully applied to estimate evaporation (E), transpiration (T), and evapotranspiration (ET) for land covered with vegetation, which has significantly important applications for the terrestrial water cycle and water resource management. One-source evapotranspiration estimation models combine the soil–vegetation components into a single source. However, in real landscape conditions, the surface is heterogeneous and contains a mixture of soil and vegetation having different temperatures and resistance to energy exchange. Therefore, one-source models explicitly cannot estimate the surface evapotranspiration accurately because the effect of.

Shuttleworth and Wallace proposed a typical two-source evapotranspiration estimation model in which the energy partition is assumed to occur in both “the above canopy” and “the under soil” cases. Water vapor and heat meet over the reference height in the interior of the canopy. Moreover, the mixed water vapor and heat can only exit through the top of the canopy; the total heat flux is in addition to the fluxes coming from every surface layer. However, the model is complex, having over five resistances that cannot be accurately calculated. In addition, the model includes required parameters and observations that cannot be readily obtained from operational satellite- and ground-based data; therefore, the range of applications of the model is limited.

The TSEB model has undergone several revisions, improving the estimation of soil and canopy net radiation, the aerodynamic resistance of the soil surface, the fractional vegetation coverage observed at the radiometer view angle, the distribution of regional-scale near-surface air temperature, and soil and canopy component temperatures. Because the TSEB model only requires the surface energy balance model with a single measurement of land surface temperature, the original model and subsequent refinements have been widely used to estimate E and T under a wide variety of vegetation types, vegetation coverage, climates, and spatial scales. However, most studies have only evaluated the total fluxes or ET (soil plus canopy) in comparison with measurements using the Bowen ratio–energy balance system, the eddy covariance (EC) system, or the large aperture scintillometer.

Accurately estimating surface fluxes in a strongly advective irrigated agricultural area is a particularly challenging task and is even more difficult when the EC flux measurements of H and LE have an incomplete energy balance closure with respect to the available energy Rn−G0. The previous sensitivity studies found that the TSEB model performance is mainly affected by the uncertainty in surface–air temperature difference. Sometimes, this difference is dominant due to the errors in determining the surface soil and vegetation component temperatures from the surface composite radiometric temperature. In this letter, it is shown that there is an overestimation of the component temperatures compared with the observed composite radiometric. This often leads to the most crucial effect on the TSEB model performance. In addition, another factor is the strong advective environment in this region.
research objective: In this letter, the ground-measured soil and canopy component temperatures were used to estimate E, T, and ET, which were better validated with observed ratios of E (E/ET%) and T (T/ET%) using the stable oxygen and hydrogen isotopes, and the ET measurements using an eddy covariance (EC) system.

The objective of this letter is to estimate E, T, and ET using the soil and canopy component temperatures observed via a high-resolution thermal camera as inputs to a series TSEB model and to subsequently better validate E, T, and ET using a combination of the stable oxygen and hydrogen isotope technique and EC measurements.
challenges: However, the current composite temperature separation approaches are limited in their effectiveness in arid regions. Moreover, E and T are difficult to measure on the ground.

Errors in the derived component temperature were primarily caused by image classification errors; these classification errors varied with vegetation abundance. The higher uncertainty of H estimation is not only caused by the uncertainty of the TSEB model but also due to the increased uncertainty of the EC system, which is 18% when the mean H is small in the irrigated farmland. Due to image pixel classification errors, soil pixels were counted as vegetation pixels, which produced an overestimation of the canopy temperature under the developing vegetation abundance. Alternatively, ignoring atmospheric upwelling radiation and transmittance could have produced the uncertainties in the estimated temperatures. In addition, the estimated uncertainty of the incoming short- and long-wave radiation transmittances through the canopy may be another source of Rn estimation errors.
methods: In this letter, the field observations were obtained from the Daman superstation installed in the central oasis, which is a 40-m boundary layer tower located at 100.3722° E, 38.8555° N and at an elevation of 1556 m. The meteorological parameters were measured every 10 min and included air temperature, wind speed, humidity at 5 m over the ground, four-component radiations (measured at 12 m above the ground using a four-component radiometer), and turbulent fluxes (measured at 4.5 m above the ground using an EC system with a sampling frequency of 10 Hz). The soil heat fluxes were measured using three heat plates located 6 cm under the ground. A Fluke Ti55 thermal infrared camera was manually operated on a 25-m-high platform on a boundary layer tower to measure the thermal radiation of the cropland approximately every 120 min; the observations were collected as thermal images from approximately 07:00 to 19:00 China Standard Time (CST) during the daytime. The ground-based measurement data were applied to partition ET into E and T applying the Craig–Gordon model.

To evaluate the TSEB model accurately, the soil heat flux was using the ground measurement. In addition, the soil and canopy sensible heat fluxes were estimated using the series TSEB model, and their latent heat fluxes were calculated while solving the energy balance equations (1) and (2), respectively. The soil and canopy component temperatures were calculated using the images obtained with the thermal camera. To calculate the component temperatures, the visible and NIR images were classified into soil and canopy pixels using the maximum-likelihood method. Next, the soil and canopy directional brightness temperatures were exacted from the thermal images. Finally, the thermal infrared temperatures were converted to the radiation temperatures using the incoming long-wave radiation from the sky and the soil and canopy emissivities. Next, the simulated radiometric temperatures were validated against the surface radiometric temperatures, which were calculated according to the incoming long-wave radiation observed by the four-component radiometer.
dataset: The experimental area is an artificial oasis that is covered with maize, vegetables, and orchards. Data of day of year (DOY) 170, 173, 176, 192, 195, 231, 252, and 256 were used to determine ET and the ratios of E (E/ET%) and T (T/ET%) to ET during the Multi-Scale Observation Experiment on Evapotranspiration over heterogeneous land surfaces, which was part of the Heihe Water Allied Telemetry Experimental Research (HiWATER-MUSOEXE).
findings: Our results indicated that even under the strongly advective conditions, the TSEB model produced reliable estimates of the E/ET% and T/ET% ratios and of ET. The mean bias and root-mean-square error (RMSE) of E/ET% were 1% and 2%, respectively, and the mean bias and RMSE of T/ET% were −1% and 2%, respectively. In addition, the model exhibited relatively reliable estimates in the latent heat flux, with mean bias and RMSE values of 31 and 61 W·m−2, respectively, compared with the measurements from the EC system. These results demonstrated that a robust soil and vegetation component temperature calculation was crucial for estimating E, T, and ET. Moreover, the separate validation of E/ET% and T/ET% provides a good prospect for TSEB model improvements.

Our results demonstrated that the TSEB model using soil and canopy component radiometric temperatures, which were obtained from a high-precision thermal infrared camera, can be applied in a strongly advection-irrigated agricultural area. Notably, the results illustrated that the latent fluxes of the soil and vegetation components were successfully separated with reasonable accuracy, as assessed using ground-based measurements. The estimated E/ET% and E/ET% values agreed well with the values observed using the stable oxygen and hydrogen isotopes technique during the early, middle, and late growing seasons. In addition, the TSEB model produced reliable estimations of Rn, H, and LE; the mean biases of Rn, H, and LE were −18, 5, and 31 W ·m−2, respectively, and the RMSEs of Rn, H, and LE were 29, 19, and 61 W · m−2, respectively. This finding suggests that given accurate soil and vegetation component temperatures, E and T can be accurately separated from ET using the TSEB model.
backgroundCn: 双源能量平衡（TSEB）模型成功应用于估算植被覆盖土地的蒸发（E）、蒸腾（T）和蒸散发（ET），这对陆地水循环和水资源管理具有重要意义。单源蒸散发估算模型将土壤-植被组件合并为一个单一源。然而，在真实的景观条件下，表面是异质的，包含具有不同温度和能量交换阻力的土壤和植被的混合物。因此，单源模型显然无法准确估算表面蒸散发，因为其影响。

Shuttleworth和Wallace提出了一种典型的双源蒸散发估算模型，该模型假设能量分配发生在“冠层上方”和“土壤下方”两种情况。水蒸气和热量在冠层内部的参考高度相遇。此外，混合的水蒸气和热量只能通过冠层顶部排出；总热通量是除了来自每个表层的通量之外的额外通量。然而，该模型较为复杂，具有超过五个无法准确计算的阻力。此外，该模型还包括一些所需的参数和观测数据，这些数据无法从操作性卫星和地面数据中轻易获得；因此，该模型的应用范围受到限制。

TSEB模型经过多次修订，改善了土壤和冠层净辐射的估算、土壤表面的气动阻力、在辐射计视角下观察到的植被覆盖度、区域尺度近地面气温的分布以及土壤和冠层组分的温度。由于TSEB模型只需要一个地表温度的单一测量值来进行表面能量平衡模型的计算，因此原始模型及其后续改进已广泛用于在各种植被类型、植被覆盖、气候和空间尺度下估算蒸散发（E）和温度（T）。然而，大多数研究仅评估了与使用波恩比-能量平衡系统、涡度协方差（EC）系统或大孔径闪烁仪的测量结果相比的总通量或蒸散发（土壤加冠层）。

在强烈对流的灌溉农业区域，准确估计表面通量是一项特别具有挑战性的任务，尤其是在涡度相关（EC）通量测量的潜热（LE）和显热（H）与可用能量（Rn−G0）之间存在能量平衡闭合不完全的情况下。之前的敏感性研究发现，TSEB模型的性能主要受到表面与空气温差不确定性的影响。有时，这种温差由于从表面复合辐射温度中确定表面土壤和植被组分温度的误差而占主导地位。本文指出，与观测到的复合辐射温度相比，组分温度存在过高估计的情况。这往往对TSEB模型的性能产生最关键的影响。此外，该区域的强对流环境也是另一个因素。
research objectiveCn: 在这封信中，地面测量的土壤和冠层成分温度被用来估算蒸散（E）、蒸发（T）和蒸散发（ET），这些估算通过稳定的氧和氢同位素以及使用涡度协方差（EC）系统的ET测量结果进行了更好的验证，得到了E（E/ET%）和T（T/ET%）的观察比率。
这封信的目的是利用高分辨率热像仪观察到的土壤和冠层组件温度作为输入，通过一系列TSEB模型来估算蒸散发（E）、温度（T）和蒸散发总量（ET），并随后结合稳定氧和氢同位素技术以及涡度相关（EC）测量更好地验证E、T和ET。
challengesCn: 然而，目前的复合温度分离方法在干旱地区的有效性有限。此外，E和T在地面上难以测量。

导出组件温度的误差主要是由于图像分类错误引起的，这些分类错误随着植被丰度的变化而变化。H估计的不确定性不仅是由于TSEB模型的不确定性，还由于EC系统的不确定性，当灌溉农田的平均H较小时，这种不确定性为18%。由于图像像素分类错误，土壤像素被错误地计为植被像素，这导致在植被丰度发展的情况下，冠层温度的过高估计。另一方面，忽略大气向上辐射和透射率可能导致估计温度的不确定性。此外，估计的通过冠层的短波和长波辐射透射率的不确定性可能是Rn估计误差的另一个来源。
methodsCn: 在这封信中，现场观测数据来自于安装在中央绿洲的达曼超级站，该站是一座40米高的边界层塔，位于东经100.3722°，北纬38.8555°，海拔1556米。气象参数每10分钟测量一次，包括地面5米处的空气温度、风速、湿度，12米高处使用四分量辐射计测量的四分量辐射，以及使用采样频率为10 Hz的涡度相关系统在4.5米高处测量的湍流通量。土壤热通量通过位于地下6厘米的三个热板进行测量。一台Fluke Ti55热红外相机在边界层塔的25米高平台上手动操作，约每120分钟测量一次农田的热辐射；观测数据在中国标准时间（CST）白天07:00至19:00期间收集为热图像。基于地面测量数据，采用Craig-Gordon模型将蒸散发（ET）分解为蒸发（E）和蒸腾（T）。

为了准确评估TSEB模型，土壤热通量使用地面测量数据。此外，土壤和冠层的感热通量是通过系列TSEB模型估算的，而它们的潜热通量则通过求解能量平衡方程（1）和（2）来计算。土壤和冠层的组件温度是通过热像仪获得的图像计算得出的。为了计算组件温度，使用最大似然法将可见光和近红外图像分类为土壤和冠层像素。接下来，从热成像图像中提取土壤和冠层的方向亮度温度。最后，利用来自天空的入射长波辐射和土壤及冠层的发射率，将热红外温度转换为辐射温度。最后，模拟的辐射温度与根据四分量辐射计观测的入射长波辐射计算的表面辐射温度进行了验证。
datasetCn: 实验区域是一个人工绿洲，种植有玉米、蔬菜和果园。使用了第170、173、176、192、195、231、252和256天的数据来确定蒸散发（ET）以及蒸发（E/ET%）和蒸腾（T/ET%）相对于ET的比率，这些研究是在多尺度蒸散发观测实验中进行的，属于黑河水文遥测实验研究（HiWATER-MUSOEXE）的一部分。
findingsCn: 我们的结果表明，即使在强烈的对流条件下，TSEB模型仍然能够可靠地估计E/ET%和T/ET%比率以及ET。E/ET%的平均偏差和均方根误差（RMSE）分别为1%和2%；而T/ET%的平均偏差和RMSE分别为−1%和2%。此外，该模型在潜热通量的估计上也表现出相对可靠的结果，与EC系统的测量值相比，平均偏差和RMSE值分别为31和61 W·m−2。这些结果表明，稳健的土壤和植被组件温度计算对于估计E、T和ET至关重要。此外，E/ET%和T/ET%的单独验证为TSEB模型的改进提供了良好的前景。

我们的结果表明，使用高精度热红外相机获得的土壤和冠层组件辐射温度的TSEB模型可以应用于强烈的平流灌溉农业区域。值得注意的是，结果表明土壤和植被组件的潜在通量成功地以合理的精度分离，经过地面测量的评估。估计的E/ET%和E/ET%值与在早期、中期和晚期生长季节使用稳定氧和氢同位素技术观察到的值一致。此外，TSEB模型对Rn、H和LE的估计也很可靠；Rn、H和LE的平均偏差分别为−18、5和31 W·m−2，Rn、H和LE的均方根误差（RMSE）分别为29、19和61 W·m−2。这一发现表明，给定准确的土壤和植被组件温度，E和T可以通过TSEB模型准确地从ET中分离出来。

background: Arid and semiarid regions represent approximately 30 % of the global terrestrial surface area (Dregne, 1991; Scanlon et al., 2006), and dryland expansion occurs under climate change, especially in developing countries (Huang et al., 2016). An oasis is a unique ecological landscape in arid and semi-arid areas that is not only the core of regions’ ecological environment but also the foundation of their economic development, especially in western China, which has been an important part of the “Silk Road” since ancient times. Oases comprising less than 10 % of the total area of arid regions support more than 90 % of the population in these regions of China (Chu et al., 2005; Li et al., 2016; Zhou et al., 2022). The oasis–desert system plays a crucial role in maintaining a stable ecological environment and agricultural productivity (Zhang and Zhao, 2015). Extensive studies have investigated energy, water vapor, and carbon exchange in oasis–desert areas based on field and remote-sensing observations (Taha et al., 1991; Potchter et al., 2008; Xue et al., 2019; Wang et al., 2019; Zhou et al., 2022) and numerical simulations (Chu et al., 2005; Meng et al., 2009; Georgescu et al., 2011; Liu et al., 2020). In addition, oasis–desert areas located in semiarid regions have been found to be carbon sinks by previous researchers (Tagesson et al., 2016; Wang et al., 2019); thus, they can significantly affect the carbon balance of arid regions and play an increasingly important role within the global carbon cycle.
research objective: Therefore, it is critical to maintain the balance between oasis and desert systems in order to achieve the goal of sustainable oasis development. Understanding the basic characteristics of energy, water vapor, and carbon exchange in oasis–desert ecosystems is important to achieve the goals of carbon peaking and carbon neutrality in the oasis–desert area and support the ecological security and sustainable development of the oasis. A quantitative understanding of the energy, water vapor, and carbon exchange in oasis–desert areas is crucial to recognize the oasis–desert interactions and is significant to protect the ecological stability and socioeconomic development of oases; moreover, long-term observations are indispensable.
challenges: Inland river basins in arid and semiarid areas are facing the crisis of ecological environment degradation, such as the drying up of rivers and lakes, the degradation of natural vegetation, the intensification of land desertification, and the frequent occurrence of dust storms, especially in many inland river basins westward along the Silk Road, such as the Tarim River basin (Zhao et al., 2013), the Aral Sea basin (Stanev et al., 2004; Crétaux et al., 2009), and the Lake Urmia basin (Stone, 2015).
methods: In this study, we present a suite of observational datasets from artificial and natural oasis–desert systems that consist of long-term energy, water vapor, carbon and methane fluxes as well as auxiliary data involving hydrometeorology, vegetation, and soil parameters from 2012 to 2021. Half-hourly turbulent flux data were acquired by an eddy covariance system and scintillometer. The hydrometeorological data (including radiation, soil heat flux, and soil temperature profiles; gradients of air temperature and humidity and of wind speed and direction; and air pressure, precipitation, and soil moisture profiles) were observed from automatic weather stations with a 10 min average period as well as the groundwater table data. Moreover, vegetation and soil parameters were also supplemented in the datasets. The data processing and quality control procedure can be divided into data collection, data processing, and data archiving and sharing.
dataset: The study area comprises the middle and lower reaches of the HRB, located in the arid regions of western China, that receive water from the typical cryosphere of the upper reaches. A total of 11 land surface flux and meteorological stations have been established in these regions since 2012 – 2 superstations and 9 ordinary stations. The dataset of energy, water vapor, and carbon exchange observations in oasis–desert areas reported in this study (including energy, water vapor, and carbon fluxes; hydrometeorological data; and vegetation and soil parameters) is freely available from the National Tibetan Plateau Data Center.
backgroundCn: 干旱和半干旱地区大约占全球陆地表面积的30%（Dregne, 1991；Scanlon et al., 2006），在气候变化的影响下，干旱地区的扩展尤其发生在发展中国家（Huang et al., 2016）。绿洲是干旱和半干旱地区独特的生态景观，不仅是这些地区生态环境的核心，也是经济发展的基础，尤其是在中国西部，该地区自古以来就是“丝绸之路”的重要组成部分。绿洲占干旱地区总面积的不到10%，却支持了中国这些地区90%以上的人口（Chu et al., 2005；Li et al., 2016；Zhou et al., 2022）。绿洲-沙漠系统在维持稳定的生态环境和农业生产力方面发挥着至关重要的作用（Zhang and Zhao, 2015）。大量研究基于实地和遥感观测（Taha et al., 1991；Potchter et al., 2008；Xue et al., 2019；Wang et al., 2019；Zhou et al., 2022）以及数值模拟（Chu et al., 2005；Meng et al., 2009；Georgescu et al., 2011；Liu et al., 2020）对绿洲-沙漠地区的能量、水汽和碳交换进行了广泛研究。此外，位于半干旱地区的绿洲-沙漠区域被先前研究者发现是碳汇（Tagesson et al., 2016；Wang et al., 2019）；因此，它们可以显著影响干旱地区的碳平衡，并在全球碳循环中发挥越来越重要的作用。
research objectiveCn: 因此，保持绿洲与沙漠系统之间的平衡对于实现可持续绿洲发展的目标至关重要。了解绿洲-沙漠生态系统中能量、水汽和碳交换的基本特征，对于实现绿洲-沙漠地区的碳达峰和碳中和目标，以及支持绿洲的生态安全和可持续发展具有重要意义。对绿洲-沙漠地区能量、水汽和碳交换的定量理解，对于认识绿洲-沙漠之间的相互作用至关重要，并且对保护生态稳定性和绿洲的社会经济发展具有重要意义；此外，长期观测是不可或缺的。
challengesCn: 内陆河流流域在干旱和半干旱地区面临生态环境退化的危机，如河流和湖泊干涸、自然植被退化、土地沙漠化加剧以及沙尘暴频繁发生，尤其是在丝绸之路沿线的许多内陆河流流域，如塔里木河流域（赵等，2013），咸海流域（Stanev等，2004；Crétaux等，2009）和乌尔米湖流域（Stone，2015）。
methodsCn: 在本研究中，我们呈现了一套来自人工和自然绿洲–沙漠系统的观测数据集，涵盖了2012年至2021年的长期能量、水蒸气、碳和甲烷通量，以及涉及水文气象、植被和土壤参数的辅助数据。半小时的湍流通量数据是通过涡度协方差系统和闪烁仪获取的。水文气象数据（包括辐射、土壤热通量和土壤温度剖面；空气温度和湿度的梯度、风速和风向的梯度；以及气压、降水和土壤湿度剖面）是通过自动气象站以10分钟的平均周期观测的，同时也包括地下水位数据。此外，数据集中还补充了植被和土壤参数。数据处理和质量控制程序可以分为数据收集、数据处理和数据归档与共享。
datasetCn: 研究区域包括位于中国西部干旱地区的HRB中下游，水源来自上游典型的冰冻圈。自2012年以来，在这些地区建立了11个地表通量和气象站，包括2个超级站和9个普通站。本研究报告的绿洲-沙漠地区能量、水汽和碳交换观测数据集（包括能量、水汽和碳通量；水文气象数据；以及植被和土壤参数）可从国家西藏高原数据中心免费获取。

Feature Specification.AnswerCn: 监测长期的能量、水汽、碳和甲烷通量，使用涡度相关系统，使用闪烁仪，每半小时数据采集，自动气象站，每10分钟收集水文气象参数，生态环境退化，土地荒漠化，沙尘暴。

Feature Specification.QuestionEn: What are the specific properties and methods used to partition evapotranspiration into soil evaporation and canopy transpiration in agricultural landscapes?
Feature Specification.QuestionCn: 在农业景观中，将蒸散发分为土壤蒸发和冠层蒸腾的具体属性和方法有哪些？
Feature Specification.AnswerEn: component temperatures of soil and canopy, thermal infrared imagery, directional brightness temperatures, energy balance equations, sensible and latent heat fluxes
Feature Specification.AnswerCn: 土壤和冠层的组分温度、热红外图像、方向亮度温度、能量平衡方程、显热和潜热通量。

Definition.QuestionEn: What is meant by 'hydrometeorological data' in the context of water resource management and ecological studies?
Definition.QuestionCn: 在水资源管理和生态研究的背景下，“水文气象数据”是什么意思？
Definition.AnswerEn: Hydrometeorological data refers to measurements related to water and weather, including radiation, soil heat flux, soil temperature profiles, gradients of air temperature and humidity, wind speed and direction, air pressure, precipitation, soil moisture profiles, and groundwater table data. These data are typically collected from automatic weather stations with specific average periods, such as 10 minutes.
Definition.AnswerCn: 水文气象数据是指与水和天气相关的测量，包括辐射、土壤热通量、土壤温度剖面、空气温度和湿度的梯度、风速和风向、气压、降水、土壤湿度剖面以及地下水位数据。这些数据通常来自自动气象站，具有特定的平均时间段，例如10分钟。

Comparison.QuestionEn: How do the data collection methods used for hydrometeorological observations in the 黑河生态水文遥感试验 dataset compare to those employed in oasis–desert systems for energy, water vapor, and carbon exchange observations?
Comparison.QuestionCn: 黑河生态水文遥感试验数据集中用于水文气象观测的数据收集方法与在绿洲-沙漠系统中用于能量、水汽和碳交换观测的方法相比如何？
Comparison.AnswerEn: In the 黑河生态水文遥感试验 dataset, data collection involves using automatic weather stations with sensors for various meteorological parameters like radiation, temperature, and soil moisture. In contrast, oasis–desert systems observations include additional measurements such as carbon and methane fluxes using eddy covariance systems and scintillometers, as well as auxiliary hydrometeorological data. Both methods emphasize temporal resolution, but oasis–desert systems often incorporate more comprehensive flux measurements.
Comparison.AnswerCn: 在黑河生态水文遥感试验数据集中，数据收集涉及使用自动气象站，配备用于测量各种气象参数的传感器，如辐射、温度和土壤湿度。相比之下，绿洲-沙漠系统的观测包括额外的测量，如使用涡度协方差系统和闪烁仪测量碳和甲烷通量，以及辅助的水文气象数据。两种方法都强调时间分辨率，但绿洲-沙漠系统通常包含更全面的通量测量。

Interpretation.QuestionEn: What challenges might arise in maintaining data quality and consistency over long-term observations in the oasis–desert ecosystems, and how can these be mitigated?
Interpretation.QuestionCn: 在对绿洲-沙漠生态系统进行长期观察时，维护数据质量和一致性可能会面临哪些挑战，以及如何减轻这些挑战？
Interpretation.AnswerEn: Challenges in maintaining data quality and consistency over long-term observations in oasis–desert ecosystems include environmental degradation, such as land desertification and dust storms, which can affect data accuracy. These can be mitigated by implementing rigorous quality control procedures, including data collection, processing, and archiving, as well as using reliable equipment like eddy covariance systems and automatic weather stations to ensure accurate and consistent data.
Interpretation.AnswerCn: 在绿洲-沙漠生态系统的长期观测中，维护数据质量和一致性面临的挑战包括环境退化，如土地沙漠化和沙尘暴，这些都可能影响数据的准确性。可以通过实施严格的质量控制程序来减轻这些问题，包括数据收集、处理和归档，以及使用可靠的设备，如涡度协方差系统和自动气象站，以确保数据的准确性和一致性。

Interpretation.QuestionEn: What are the implications of using multi-scale observational data in understanding energy and carbon exchanges in arid regions, and how might this approach benefit future research in climate change impacts on these ecosystems?
Interpretation.QuestionCn: 使用多尺度观测数据来理解干旱地区的能量和碳交换的影响是什么？这种方法如何有利于未来气候变化对这些生态系统影响的研究？
Interpretation.AnswerEn: Using multi-scale observational data allows for a comprehensive understanding of energy and carbon exchanges in arid regions by capturing variations across different spatial and temporal scales. This approach provides detailed insights into the interactions between oasis and desert systems, which is crucial for predicting the impacts of climate change. It benefits future research by offering a robust framework for examining ecological stability and supporting sustainable development strategies in these vulnerable ecosystems.
Interpretation.AnswerCn: 使用多尺度观测数据可以全面理解干旱地区的能量和碳交换，通过捕捉不同空间和时间尺度的变化。这种方法提供了对绿洲和沙漠系统之间相互作用的详细洞察，这对于预测气候变化的影响至关重要。它为未来的研究提供了一个稳健的框架，以检查生态稳定性并支持这些脆弱生态系统的可持续发展战略。

Causal Antecedent.QuestionEn: What factors contribute to the data quality issues and missing data in hydrometeorological observations in oasis-desert systems?
Causal Antecedent.QuestionCn: 在绿洲-沙漠系统中，影响水文气象观测数据质量问题和缺失数据的因素有哪些？
Causal Antecedent.AnswerEn: Data quality issues and missing data in hydrometeorological observations can arise due to storage problems, sensor malfunctions, and environmental conditions. For example, data storage issues can lead to data loss over certain periods, while sensor malfunctions can result in sporadic missing data or erroneous readings. Additionally, the physical environment, such as the presence of strong advective conditions, can impact the accuracy of measurements.
Causal Antecedent.AnswerCn: 水文气象观测中的数据质量问题和缺失数据可能由于存储问题、传感器故障和环境条件而产生。例如，数据存储问题可能导致某些时间段的数据丢失，而传感器故障可能导致偶发的缺失数据或错误读数。此外，物理环境，如强的平流条件，可能会影响测量的准确性。

Causal Antecedent.QuestionEn: Why is it challenging to accurately separate soil and canopy temperatures in arid agricultural regions using remote sensing data?
Causal Antecedent.QuestionCn: 为什么在干旱农业地区使用遥感数据准确区分土壤和冠层温度具有挑战性？
Causal Antecedent.AnswerEn: Accurately separating soil and canopy temperatures in arid agricultural regions is challenging due to classification errors in remote sensing images, which can misclassify soil pixels as vegetation and vice versa. This leads to overestimation or underestimation of component temperatures. Moreover, factors like atmospheric upwelling radiation and transmittance are often ignored, contributing to uncertainties in temperature estimation.
Causal Antecedent.AnswerCn: 在干旱农业地区，准确分离土壤和冠层温度具有挑战性，因为遥感图像中的分类错误可能将土壤像素误分类为植被，反之亦然。这导致了对组成温度的高估或低估。此外，像大气上行辐射和透射率等因素通常被忽视，进一步增加了温度估计的不确定性。

Causal Antecedent.QuestionEn: What factors lead to challenges in measuring energy, water vapor, and carbon exchange in oasis-desert ecosystems?
Causal Antecedent.QuestionCn: 在绿洲-沙漠生态系统中，测量能量、水蒸气和碳交换面临的挑战因素有哪些？
Causal Antecedent.AnswerEn: Challenges in measuring energy, water vapor, and carbon exchange in oasis-desert ecosystems are primarily caused by environmental degradation issues like river and lake drying, land desertification, and natural vegetation degradation. These factors affect the ecological balance and complicate the accurate measurement and modeling of these exchanges, requiring long-term and comprehensive observational datasets to understand the dynamics effectively.
Causal Antecedent.AnswerCn: 在绿洲-沙漠生态系统中，测量能量、水蒸气和碳交换的挑战主要是由于环境退化问题，如河流和湖泊干涸、土地沙漠化以及自然植被退化。这些因素影响生态平衡，并使得准确测量和建模这些交换变得复杂，要求长期和全面的观测数据集以有效理解这些动态。

Causal Consequence.QuestionEn: How does the inclusion of stable oxygen and hydrogen isotopes enhance the validation of evapotranspiration measurements in agricultural areas?
Causal Consequence.QuestionCn: 稳定氧和氢同位素的纳入如何增强农业地区蒸散发测量的验证？
Causal Consequence.AnswerEn: The inclusion of stable oxygen and hydrogen isotopes enhances the validation of evapotranspiration measurements by providing a better comparison of the ratios of evaporation and transpiration to total evapotranspiration, allowing for more accurate assessments of component fluxes.
Causal Consequence.AnswerCn: 稳定的氧和氢同位素的引入增强了蒸散发测量的验证，通过提供蒸发和蒸腾与总蒸散发比率的更好比较，从而允许对组成通量进行更准确的评估。

Causal Consequence.QuestionEn: What are the consequences of integrating long-term energy, water vapor, and carbon flux datasets from oasis-desert systems into ecological and socioeconomic planning?
Causal Consequence.QuestionCn: 将绿洲-沙漠系统的长期能源、水汽和碳通量数据集整合到生态和社会经济规划中会产生什么后果？
Causal Consequence.AnswerEn: Integrating long-term datasets from oasis-desert systems into planning can improve the understanding of energy, water vapor, and carbon exchanges, supporting ecological stability and sustainable development in arid regions, and aiding in achieving carbon peaking and carbon neutrality goals.
Causal Consequence.AnswerCn: 将长期数据集整合到绿洲-沙漠系统的规划中，可以提高对能量、水汽和碳交换的理解，支持干旱地区的生态稳定和可持续发展，并有助于实现碳达峰和碳中和目标。

Goal Orientation.QuestionEn: What are the intended outcomes of maintaining a long-term dataset of energy, water vapor, and carbon fluxes in oasis-desert ecosystems?
Goal Orientation.QuestionCn: 维护绿洲-沙漠生态系统中能量、水汽和碳通量的长期数据集的预期结果是什么？
Goal Orientation.AnswerEn: The purpose is to gain a quantitative understanding of oasis-desert interactions, which is significant for protecting ecological stability, supporting socioeconomic development, and contributing to carbon peaking and carbon neutrality goals.
Goal Orientation.AnswerCn: 目的在于获得对绿洲-沙漠相互作用的定量理解，这对保护生态稳定、支持社会经济发展以及为碳达峰和碳中和目标做出贡献具有重要意义。

Instrumental/Procedural.QuestionEn: What procedures are followed in the data collection method to ensure the quality and accuracy of hydrometeorological observations in oasis–desert systems?
Instrumental/Procedural.QuestionCn: 在绿洲-沙漠系统中，为确保水文气象观测的质量和准确性，遵循哪些数据收集方法的程序？
Instrumental/Procedural.AnswerEn: The data collection method involves ensuring the quality and accuracy of hydrometeorological observations through a series of steps, including data processing, quality control, and data archiving. The quality control procedure includes removing duplicate records, eliminating data that exceed physical or instrument limits, marking questionable data, and ensuring consistent date and time formats. Additionally, the data are collected using automatic weather stations with a 10-minute average period, and the quality control process also involves addressing data storage issues and sensor malfunctions.
Instrumental/Procedural.AnswerCn: 数据收集方法涉及通过一系列步骤确保水文气象观测的质量和准确性，包括数据处理、质量控制和数据归档。质量控制程序包括删除重复记录、消除超过物理或仪器限制的数据、标记可疑数据，以及确保日期和时间格式的一致性。此外，数据是通过自动气象站以10分钟的平均周期收集的，质量控制过程还涉及解决数据存储问题和传感器故障。

Instrumental/Procedural.QuestionEn: How can soil and canopy component temperatures be accurately estimated during the data collection process for energy balance models in agricultural areas?
Instrumental/Procedural.QuestionCn: 在农业地区的数据收集过程中，如何准确估计土壤和冠层组件的温度，以用于能量平衡模型？
Instrumental/Procedural.AnswerEn: To accurately estimate soil and canopy component temperatures, high-resolution thermal cameras are used to capture thermal images, which are then classified into soil and canopy pixels using the maximum-likelihood method. The thermal infrared temperatures are converted to radiation temperatures using incoming long-wave radiation data and soil and canopy emissivities. The estimated component temperatures are validated against surface radiometric temperatures calculated from radiometer observations.
Instrumental/Procedural.AnswerCn: 为了准确估计土壤和冠层组分的温度，使用高分辨率热像仪捕捉热图像，然后使用最大似然法将其分类为土壤和冠层像素。热红外温度通过入射的长波辐射数据和土壤及冠层的发射率转换为辐射温度。估计的组分温度通过从辐射计观测中计算的表面辐射温度进行验证。

Enablement.QuestionEn: What technological advancements enable the effective separation of soil and canopy component temperatures in strongly advective irrigated agricultural areas?
Enablement.QuestionCn: 哪些技术进步使得在强烈的对流灌溉农业区域有效分离土壤和冠层组件温度成为可能？
Enablement.AnswerEn: The use of high-precision thermal infrared cameras enables the effective separation of soil and canopy component temperatures by capturing thermal radiation, which can then be used to calculate radiometric temperatures. This technology allows for more accurate estimation of evaporation, transpiration, and evapotranspiration in complex environments.
Enablement.AnswerCn: 高精度热红外相机的使用能够有效分离土壤和冠层组件的温度，通过捕捉热辐射，从而计算辐射温度。这项技术使得在复杂环境中更准确地估算蒸发、蒸腾和蒸散成为可能。

Enablement.QuestionEn: What conditions and methodologies enable the validation of evapotranspiration models using stable isotopes and eddy covariance systems?
Enablement.QuestionCn: 哪些条件和方法论能够通过稳定同位素和涡度协方差系统验证蒸散发模型？
Enablement.AnswerEn: The use of ground-measured soil and canopy component temperatures, in conjunction with high-resolution thermal imaging, allows for the validation of evapotranspiration models. Stable oxygen and hydrogen isotopes, along with measurements from eddy covariance systems, provide accurate validations of evapotranspiration ratios, improving the model's reliability in diverse vegetation and climatic conditions.
Enablement.AnswerCn: 使用地面测量的土壤和冠层组分温度，以及高分辨率热成像，可以验证蒸散发模型。稳定的氧和氢同位素，以及涡度协方差系统的测量，提供了蒸散发比率的准确验证，提高了模型在不同植被和气候条件下的可靠性。

Expectation.QuestionEn: Why are errors in component temperature estimation a significant concern when using thermal infrared cameras for data collection in agricultural areas?
Expectation.QuestionCn: 在农业领域使用热红外相机进行数据收集时，组件温度估计中的错误为何是一个重要问题？
Expectation.AnswerEn: Errors can arise from image classification inaccuracies, especially in areas with varying vegetation abundance, leading to misclassification of soil and vegetation pixels. This can result in overestimation of canopy temperatures, affecting the accuracy of energy partitioning models like the TSEB model used to estimate evapotranspiration components in agricultural settings.
Expectation.AnswerCn: 图像分类不准确可能导致错误，尤其是在植被丰度变化的区域，这会导致土壤和植被像素的误分类。这可能导致冠层温度的高估，从而影响像TSEB模型这样的能量分配模型在农业环境中估算蒸散发组成部分的准确性。

Expectation.QuestionEn: Why might it be challenging to accurately separate soil and vegetation component temperatures in strongly advective irrigated agricultural areas?
Expectation.QuestionCn: 在强烈的对流灌溉农业区域，准确分离土壤和植被成分温度可能面临挑战的原因是什么？
Expectation.AnswerEn: In strongly advective environments, the surface-air temperature difference can dominate errors due to uncertainties in determining component temperatures from composite radiometric temperatures. This challenge is further compounded by the complex interactions and resistances involved in energy exchange between soil and vegetation, requiring precise measurement techniques.
Expectation.AnswerCn: 在强对流环境中，表面与空气温度的差异可能主导由于从复合辐射温度确定组分温度的不确定性所导致的误差。这一挑战因土壤与植被之间能量交换的复杂相互作用和阻力而进一步加剧，要求采用精确的测量技术。

Judgmental.QuestionEn: How effective are the current data collection methods in capturing the dynamic interactions between soil and vegetation in oasis-desert ecosystems?
Judgmental.QuestionCn: 当前的数据收集方法在捕捉绿洲-沙漠生态系统中土壤与植被之间的动态相互作用方面的有效性如何？
Judgmental.AnswerEn: Current data collection methods, such as the use of eddy covariance systems and thermal infrared cameras, are effective in separating and capturing the latent fluxes of soil and vegetation components. These methods provide reliable estimates of energy, water vapor, and carbon exchange in oasis-desert ecosystems, demonstrating their potential in capturing the dynamic interactions within these systems.
Judgmental.AnswerCn: 当前的数据收集方法，如涡度协方差系统和热红外相机，能够有效地分离和捕捉土壤和植被成分的潜在通量。这些方法提供了对绿洲-沙漠生态系统中能量、水蒸气和碳交换的可靠估计，展示了它们在捕捉这些系统动态相互作用中的潜力。

Judgmental.QuestionEn: What are the primary challenges in ensuring the accuracy and reliability of datasets related to evapotranspiration in heterogeneous agricultural landscapes?
Judgmental.QuestionCn: 确保与异质农业景观相关的蒸散发数据集的准确性和可靠性的主要挑战是什么？
Judgmental.AnswerEn: Challenges in ensuring accuracy include errors in composite temperature separation, image classification errors, and uncertainties in short- and long-wave radiation transmittances. These issues can lead to overestimations of canopy temperature and inaccuracies in energy balance calculations, which affect the reliability of evapotranspiration datasets in heterogeneous landscapes.
Judgmental.AnswerCn: 确保准确性面临的挑战包括复合温度分离中的错误、图像分类错误以及短波和长波辐射透过率的不确定性。这些问题可能导致对冠层温度的高估和能量平衡计算的不准确，从而影响异质景观中蒸散发数据集的可靠性。

Judgmental.QuestionEn: In what ways might dataset expansion improve our understanding of energy and water vapor exchanges in arid regions?
Judgmental.QuestionCn: 数据集扩展可能会在哪些方面改善我们对干旱地区能量和水汽交换的理解？
Judgmental.AnswerEn: Expanding datasets to include long-term observations and additional parameters, such as methane fluxes and detailed vegetation and soil characteristics, can significantly enhance our understanding of energy and water vapor exchanges. This expansion allows for a more comprehensive analysis of oasis-desert interactions and supports ecological stability and sustainable development strategies in arid regions.
Judgmental.AnswerCn: 扩展数据集以包括长期观测和额外参数，如甲烷通量以及详细的植被和土壤特征，可以显著增强我们对能量和水蒸气交换的理解。这种扩展允许对绿洲-沙漠相互作用进行更全面的分析，并支持干旱地区的生态稳定性和可持续发展战略。

Assertion.QuestionEn: I don't understand how data quality control is effectively managed in meteorological and hydrological observations over an extended period.
Assertion.QuestionCn: 我不明白在长期的气象和水文观测中，数据质量控制是如何有效管理的。
Assertion.AnswerEn: Data quality control in meteorological and hydrological observations involves several steps including ensuring a consistent number of data points daily, marking missing data with specific indicators, removing duplicate records, deleting data that exceed physical or instrument ranges, and marking questionable data. It also involves consistent formatting of date and time and follows specific naming rules. This process is crucial to maintain data integrity over extended periods.
Assertion.AnswerCn: 气象和水文观测中的数据质量控制涉及多个步骤，包括确保每天数据点数量一致，用特定指示符标记缺失数据，删除重复记录，删除超出物理或仪器范围的数据，以及标记可疑数据。它还涉及日期和时间的一致格式化，并遵循特定的命名规则。这个过程对于在较长时间内维护数据完整性至关重要。

Request/Directive.QuestionEn: Please provide an analysis of the data processing and quality control techniques applied to hydrometeorological datasets in arid regions.
Request/Directive.QuestionCn: 请提供对干旱地区水文气象数据集所应用的数据处理和质量控制技术的分析。
Request/Directive.AnswerEn: The data processing and quality control for hydrometeorological datasets in arid regions involve ensuring consistent data collection, processing, archiving, and sharing. Specific measures include collecting data at regular intervals, handling missing data by marking them with specific codes like -6999, removing duplicate records, and deleting data that exceed physical or instrumental limits. The format for date and time is standardized to ensure uniformity. Additionally, data with potential issues are highlighted for further scrutiny.
Request/Directive.AnswerCn: 在干旱地区，水文气象数据集的数据处理和质量控制涉及确保数据收集、处理、归档和共享的一致性。具体措施包括定期收集数据，使用特定代码（如-6999）标记缺失数据，删除重复记录，以及删除超过物理或仪器限制的数据。日期和时间的格式经过标准化，以确保一致性。此外，存在潜在问题的数据会被标记以便进一步审查。

Request/Directive.QuestionEn: Please explore potential strategies for expanding datasets related to energy, water vapor, and carbon exchange in oasis–desert systems.
Request/Directive.QuestionCn: 请探讨扩展与绿洲-沙漠系统中能量、水蒸气和碳交换相关的数据集的潜在策略。
Request/Directive.AnswerEn: Strategies for expanding datasets related to energy, water vapor, and carbon exchange in oasis–desert systems could include establishing additional land surface flux and meteorological stations across diverse geographic areas to capture variations. Incorporating advanced remote sensing technologies and high-resolution thermal cameras can enhance data collection capabilities. Long-term observations are crucial for understanding ecosystem interactions, so maintaining continuous and consistent data collection over extended periods is recommended. Collaborations with organizations such as the National Tibetan Plateau Data Center could facilitate data sharing and integration.
Request/Directive.AnswerCn: 扩展与绿洲-沙漠系统中能量、水汽和碳交换相关的数据集的策略可以包括在不同地理区域建立更多的地表通量和气象站，以捕捉变化。结合先进的遥感技术和高分辨率热成像相机可以增强数据收集能力。长期观测对于理解生态系统相互作用至关重要，因此建议在较长时间内保持连续和一致的数据收集。与国家西藏高原数据中心等组织的合作可以促进数据共享和整合。
